title: [Placements] Stop Wasting Placement Slots If You Don‚Äôt Even Want Them
content:
Okay guys, placements. I know you‚Äôre all sick of hearing about it by now. The process is random as hell, shortlisting feels like dice-roll luck, and honestly it‚Äôs exhausting. It‚Äôs already September, everyone‚Äôs stressed out, and yeah, I‚Äôve faced a couple rejections too. It sucks, but fine that‚Äôs part of it.

But here‚Äôs what annoys me: the people with high GPAs (the 8.5+ gang) who *already know* they‚Äôre aiming for fat CTCs, still showing up for T2/T1 (12LPA) tests. Like bro, you don‚Äôt even want that 10‚Äì12 LPA role, then why sit for the OA? Why get shortlisted, ace it (sometimes by copying), and then either ghost the interview or purposely screw it up? For what? You‚Äôre literally taking up a spot from someone who actually needs it.

Same thing with internships. Some people just show up, then say ‚Äúeh it‚Äôs just an internship, I‚Äôll bomb the interview.‚Äù Why even waste everyone‚Äôs time?

Placements are already tough, man. People are stressed, rejections keep piling up, some of us can‚Äôt even sleep properly. The least you can do is not clog the system if you don‚Äôt even plan to go through with it.

So yeah, if you‚Äôre in final year and already sitting pretty with a crazy GPA and aiming for only the big ones  do everyone a favor and skip the T2 grind. Let people who actually want those jobs have a fair shot.

Don‚Äôt block someone else‚Äôs chance just because you‚Äôre bored or treating it like practice.

Many people for BT, DTCI did this.

At the end of the day, you can‚Äôt really blame students for writing every test. The real problem is with the placement office and the rules they put in place. Don‚Äôt hate the player, hate the game.
